a.g: When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]
And when the stars fall, dispersing,
And when the mountains are removed
And when full-term she-camels are neglected
And when the wild beasts are gathered
And when the seas are filled with flame
And when the souls are paired
And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked
For what sin she was killed
And when the pages are made public
And when the sky is stripped away
And when Hellfire is set ablaze
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Fear and Hope
And in Surah At-Takwir (The Folding Up), the terrors of the Day of Resurrection and the unveiling of the final outcome, and that is His saying, the Exalted: 'And when the Hellfire (Al-Jahim) is kindled (su'irat), and when Paradise is brought near, a soul (Nafs) will know what it has prepared.' And in 'Amma Yatasa'alun (Surah An-Naba'), 'The Day when a person will see what his hands have sent forth' - the verse, and His saying, the Exalted: 'They will not speak except whom the Most Merciful (Ar-Rahman) has permitted and says what is correct.' And the Quran from its beginning to its end is fears for whoever reads it with contemplation.

a.g: And when Paradise is brought near,
A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].
So I swear by the retreating stars -
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Meditation
Then look at how Allah has magnified the matter of the heavens and the stars in His Book, for there is no surah except that it contains their glorification in places, and how many oaths in the Quran are by them, such as His saying, the Exalted: 'And by the heaven with its constellations' (85:1), and 'And by the heaven and the night-comer' (86:1), and 'And by the heaven with its paths' (51:7), and 'And by the heaven and He who built it' (91:5), and His saying, the Exalted: 'By the sun and its brightness' (91:1), and 'And by the moon when it follows it' (91:2), and His saying, the Exalted: 'So I swear by the receding ones (al-Khunnas), the moving ones (al-JawÄr), the hiding ones (al-Kunnas)' (81:15-16), and His saying: 'And by the star when it sets' (53:1), 'So I swear by the positions of the stars' (56:75), 'And indeed, it is an oath, if you only knew, great' (56:76). You have known that the wonders of the filthy drop (an-Nutfa) have baffled the knowledge of the former and the latter, and Allah did not swear by it, so what do you think of that by which Allah, the Exalted, has sworn and referred the provisions (al-ArzÄq) to it and attributed them to it, saying, the Exalted: 'And in the heaven is your provision (Rizq) and what you are promised' (51:22), and He praised those who contemplate (al-MufakkirÄ«n) in it, saying: 'And they contemplate (YatafakkarÅ«n) in the creation of the heavens and the earth' (3:191).

a.g: Those that run [their courses] and disappear -
And by the night as it closes in
And by the dawn when it breathes
[That] indeed, the Qur'an is a word [conveyed by] a noble messenger
[Who is] possessed of power and with the Owner of the Throne, secure [in position],
Obeyed there [in the heavens] and trustworthy.
And your companion is not [at all] mad.
And he has already seen Gabriel in the clear horizon.
And Muhammad is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.
And the Qur'an is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].
So where are you going?
It is not except a reminder to the worlds
For whoever wills among you to take a right course.
And you do not will except that Allah wills - Lord of the worlds.
